name: asyncoro
short_description: asyncoro is a Python framework for developing concurrent, distributed, network programs with asynchronous completions and coroutines. Asynchronous completions implemented in asyncoro are sockets (non-blocking sockets), database cursors, sleep timers and locking primitives. Programs developed with asyncoro have same logic and structure as Python programs with threads, except for a few syntactic changes. asyncoro supports socket I/O notification mechanisms epoll, kqueue, /dev/poll (and poll and select, where necessary), and Windows I/O Completion Ports (IOCP) for high performance and scalability, and SSL for security
summary: Python framework for asynchronous, concurrent, distributed programming
